thread.title: A 3rd F1 world title would secure legacy for Lewis Hamilton
thread.title_full: A 3rd F1 world title would secure legacy for Lewis Hamilton

author: JIM VERTUNO
title: A 3rd F1 world title would secure legacy for Lewis Hamilton
text:
Eric Gay A 3rd F1 world title would secure legacy for Lewis Hamilton 
Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton, of Britain, responds to a question during a news conference at the Formula One U.S. Grand Prix auto race at the Circuit of the Americas, Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015, in Austin, Texas. (AP Photo/Eric Gay) Jay Janner A 3rd F1 world title would secure legacy for Lewis Hamilton 
Formula 1 race car driver Lewis Hamilton, middle, races Kaelyn Sanabria, left, 9, and Ethan Scott, 14, in go karts at K1 Speed Indoor Kart Racing in Austin, Texas, on Wednesday Oct.21, 2015. Hamilton spent time with the children as part of a promotional appearance for Epson, a sponsor of Mercedes AMG Petronas Formual 1 team. (Jay Janner/Austin American-Statesman via AP) AUSTIN CHRONICLE OUT, COMMUNITY IMPACT OUT, INTERNET AND TV MUST CREDIT PHOTOGRAPHER AND STATESMAN.COM, MAGS OUT; MANDATORY CREDIT John Locher A 3rd F1 world title would secure legacy for Lewis Hamilton 
Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton, of Britain, responds to a question during a news conference at the Formula One U.S. Grand Prix auto race at the Circuit of the Americas, Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015, in Austin, Texas. (AP Photo/John Locher) Jay Janner A 3rd F1 world title would secure legacy for Lewis Hamilton 
Formula 1 race car driver Lewis Hamilton talks to, from left, Ethan Scott, 14, Grant Bohlmann, 12, Travon Williams, 10, and Kaelyn Sanabria, 9, after he raced them in go karts at K1 Speed Indoor Kart Racing in Austin, Texas, on Wednesday Oct.21, 2015. Hamilton spent time with the children as part of a promotional appearance for Epson, a sponsor of Mercedes AMG Petronas Formual 1 team. (Jay Janner/Austin American-Statesman via AP) AUSTIN CHRONICLE OUT, COMMUNITY IMPACT OUT, INTERNET AND TV MUST CREDIT PHOTOGRAPHER AND STATESMAN.COM, MAGS OUT; MANDATORY CREDIT Jay Janner A 3rd F1 world title would secure legacy for Lewis Hamilton 
Formula 1 race car driver Lewis Hamilton races a go-kart against four young motorsports fans at K1 Speed Indoor Kart Racing in Austin, Texas, on Wednesday Oct.21, 2015. Hamilton spent time with the children as part of a promotional appearance for Epson, a sponsor of Mercedes AMG Petronas Formual 1 team. (Jay Janner/Austin American-Statesman via AP) AUSTIN CHRONICLE OUT, COMMUNITY IMPACT OUT, INTERNET AND TV MUST CREDIT PHOTOGRAPHER AND STATESMAN.COM, MAGS OUT; MANDATORY CREDIT Eric Gay World title within grasp for reigning F1 champ Hamilton 
Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton, of Britain, front, answers a question as Red Bull driver Daniel Ricciardo, of Australia, rear, listens during a news conference for the Formula One U.S. Grand Prix auto race at the Circuit of the Americas, Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015, in Austin, Texas. (AP Photo/Eric Gay) Eric Gay World title within grasp for reigning F1 champ Hamilton 
Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton, of Britain, left, and Red Bull driver Daniel Ricciardo, of Australia, depart a news conference at the Formula One U.S. Grand Prix auto race at the Circuit of the Americas, Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015, in Austin, Texas. (AP Photo/Eric Gay) Eric Gay A 3rd F1 world title would secure legacy for Lewis Hamilton 
Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton, of Britain, left, and Red Bull driver Daniel Ricciardo, of Australia, depart a news conference at the Formula One U.S. Grand Prix auto race at the Circuit of the Americas, Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015, in Austin, Texas. (AP Photo/Eric Gay) John Locher A 3rd F1 world title would secure legacy for Lewis Hamilton 
Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton, left, of Britain, talks with Red Bull driver Daniel Ricciardo, of Australia, as they leave a news conference at the Formula One U.S. Grand Prix auto race at the Circuit of the Americas, Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015, in Austin, Texas. (AP Photo/John Locher) Eric Gay World title within grasp for reigning F1 champ Hamilton 
Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton, of Britain, waits for a news conference to begin at the Formula One U.S. Grand Prix auto race at the Circuit of the Americas, Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015, in Austin, Texas. (AP Photo/Eric Gay) A 3rd F1 world title would secure legacy for Lewis Hamilton Associated Press | 
AUSTIN, Texas (AP) — Thirty miles away from the Circuit of the Americas, with its iconic red, white and blue racing stripes and grandstands that will be filled with more than 100,000 fans for the United States Grand Prix, Lewis Hamilton was being a kid again. 
Formula One's 30-year-old defending world champion was back where he loves to be, on a go-kart track tucked into a north Austin industrial park, zipping his racer through wicked turns and tight corners similar to those where he honed his craft in Britain.
